introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.summary: This chapter introduces the research problem of bridging the gap between laboratory drone development and real-world field applications. It establishes the need for intelligent systems that can seamlessly transition from controlled environments to complex outdoor scenarios.
keyPoints: Research domains: Human-drone interaction and crossreality
Contribution: Novel testbed environment for drone development
Overview of intelligent systems for next-generation functionality

problemStatement.title: Problem Statement
problemStatement.summary: Defines the core challenges in developing drone systems that can operate effectively in both laboratory and field environments. Addresses the complexity of human-drone collaboration and the need for adaptive intelligent systems.
keyPoints: Gap between lab testing and field deployment

testbedEnvironment.title: A Testbed Environment for Task Development
testbedEnvironment.summary: Presents a comprehensive testbed environment designed to bridge laboratory and field testing. The system provides a controlled yet realistic environment for developing and validating drone functionalities before field deployment.
keyPoints: Modular architecture for different drone platforms
Integration of simulation and physical testing

hardwareEnvironment.title: Hardware Environment
hardwareEnvironment.summary: Details the hardware components and setup of the testbed environment, including drone selection criteria, flight arena design, and spatial localization systems. Covers the physical infrastructure needed for reliable testing.
keyPoints: Flight arena design and safety considerations

softwareEnvironment.title: Software Environment
softwareEnvironment.summary: Describes the software architecture and middleware solutions that enable seamless integration between different system components. Covers the virtualization of physical objects and task management layers.

humanDroneInterfaces.title: Experimentations for Human-Drone Interfaces
humanDroneInterfaces.summary: Explores innovative interfaces for human-drone interaction, including gesture control and mixed reality systems. Investigates how humans can intuitively control and collaborate with drone systems.
keyPoints: Mixed reality interfaces for drone operation

industrialDeployment.title: In Vivo Deployment for Industrial Environments
industrialDeployment.summary: Demonstrates real-world applications of the developed systems in industrial settings. Shows how the lab-developed technologies perform in actual field conditions and industrial use cases.

carrierDroneDesign.title: Carrier Drone Design
carrierDroneDesign.summary: Presents the design and development of specialized carrier drones for industrial applications. Covers the engineering considerations for payload capacity, flight stability, and operational requirements.

semiAutonomousScan.title: Semi-autonomous Scan of a Zone
semiAutonomousScan.summary: Describes the implementation of semi-autonomous scanning capabilities for area surveillance and mapping. Combines automated flight patterns with human oversight for optimal coverage and safety.

structuralInspection.title: Structural Inspection of Vibrations
structuralInspection.summary: Details the application of drone systems for structural health monitoring through vibration analysis. Demonstrates how drones can be used for non-invasive inspection of buildings and infrastructure.

conclusion.title: Conclusion
conclusion.summary: Summarizes the research contributions and outcomes, highlighting the successful development of intelligent systems for next-generation drone functionality. Discusses future research directions and potential applications.

keyContributions.title: Key Contributions
keyContributions.summary: Outlines the novel contributions of this research to the field of robotics and human-drone interaction, highlighting the innovative approaches and methodologies developed.
keyPoints: Novel testbed environment for drone development

mixedRealityInterface.title: Mixed Reality Interface
mixedRealityInterface.summary: Explores the development and implementation of mixed reality interfaces for drone control, enabling intuitive spatial interaction and enhanced situational awareness.
keyPoints: Performance evaluation in mixed reality environments

semiAutonomousScan.title: Semi-autonomous Scan of a Zone
semiAutonomousScan.summary: Describes the implementation of semi-autonomous scanning capabilities for area surveillance and mapping. Combines automated flight patterns with human oversight for optimal coverage and safety.

structuralInspection.title: Structural Inspection of Vibrations
structuralInspection.summary: Details the application of drone systems for structural health monitoring through vibration analysis. Demonstrates how drones can be used for non-invasive inspection of buildings and infrastructure.

testbedDemonstration.title: Testbed Demonstration
testbedDemonstration.summary: Presents practical demonstrations of the testbed environment capabilities, including choreographed drone movements and system validation experiments.

futureDirections.title: Future Directions
futureDirections.summary: Discusses potential future research directions and applications building on the foundations established in this thesis work.

flightArenaLocalization.title: Flight Arena & Localization
flightArenaLocalization.summary: Details the design and implementation of the flight arena with precise spatial localization systems for accurate drone positioning and tracking.

coverageStabilityAnalysis.title: Coverage & Stability Analysis
coverageStabilityAnalysis.summary: Analyzes the coverage patterns and flight stability characteristics of the drone systems within the testbed environment.

middlewareSolutions.title: Middleware Solutions
middlewareSolutions.summary: Explores the middleware architecture that enables seamless communication between different system components and drone platforms.

objectVirtualization.title: Object Virtualization
objectVirtualization.summary: Describes the virtualization techniques used to create digital representations of physical drone objects for simulation and testing.

swarmManagement.title: Swarm Management
swarmManagement.summary: Presents the swarm management layer that coordinates multiple drone operations and ensures collision-free collaborative behaviors.

computerVisionPipeline.title: Computer Vision Pipeline
computerVisionPipeline.summary: Details the computer vision processing pipeline used for gesture recognition and human pose detection in drone control systems.

poseRecognitionAlgorithms.title: Pose Recognition Algorithms
poseRecognitionAlgorithms.summary: Explores the algorithms and techniques used for recognizing human poses and gestures for intuitive drone control interfaces.

performanceAnalysis.title: Performance Analysis
performanceAnalysis.summary: Provides comprehensive performance analysis of the human-drone interaction systems, including accuracy, latency, and user experience metrics.

networkArchitecture.title: Network Architecture
networkArchitecture.summary: Describes the network architecture that enables real-time communication between mixed reality interfaces and drone systems.

eventSharingWorkflow.title: Event Sharing Workflow
eventSharingWorkflow.summary: Details the workflow for sharing events and data between different components of the mixed reality drone control system.

mrPerformanceTesting.title: MR Performance Testing
mrPerformanceTesting.summary: Evaluates the performance characteristics of mixed reality interfaces in drone control applications, including latency and user experience metrics.

onboardComponents.title: Onboard Components
onboardComponents.summary: Details the selection and integration of onboard components for the carrier drone system, including sensors, processors, and communication modules.

dampingOptimization.title: Damping Optimization
dampingOptimization.summary: Explores optimization techniques for reducing vibrations and improving stability in carrier drone operations through advanced damping systems.

dataAcquisitionSystems.title: Data Acquisition Systems
dataAcquisitionSystems.summary: Describes the design and implementation of data acquisition systems for collecting sensor data during autonomous scanning operations.

footstepDetection.title: Footstep Detection
footstepDetection.summary: Presents experiments and methodologies for detecting human footsteps using drone-mounted vibration sensors for structural monitoring applications.

testbedResults.title: Testbed Results
testbedResults.summary: Presents the experimental results and validation outcomes from the testbed environment, demonstrating system capabilities and performance.

sensorEvaluation.title: Sensor Evaluation
sensorEvaluation.summary: Evaluates the performance and accuracy of various sensors used in the drone systems for different monitoring and inspection applications.

sensitivityAnalysis.title: Sensitivity Analysis
sensitivityAnalysis.summary: Conducts sensitivity analysis of the sensor systems to determine detection thresholds and optimal operating parameters.
